thread.title: Albany Academy wins Class A golf title
thread.title_full: Albany Academy wins Class A golf title - Times Union

author: Pete Dougherty
title: Albany Academy wins Class A golf title
text:

Buy this photo Photo: Lori Van Buren Austin Fox of Bethlehem watches his ball just miss the hole during... Image 11 of 11 Albany Academy wins Class A golf title 1 / 11 Back to Gallery Clifton Park
When a sophomore-heavy Albany Academy team won the Section II Class A golf championship two years ago, it was a surprise. When those same Cadets finished third last year, it was a disappointment.
So in their final shot to show that the 2013 title wasn't a fluke, four Academy seniors were on a mission Wednesday at Eagle Crest Golf Club .
Tom Sneeringer carded an even-par 72 to lead four Cadets who shot 80 or lower to give Academy its second sectional championship in three years.
"That's a day marked on our calendars since that day," said Sneeringer, referring to last year's sectionals. "We had a bitter taste in our mouth. We figured we would come out here and give it our best shot, and it worked out for us."
Albany Academy ended 11 strokes behind co-winners CBA and Shaker last year. This time the Cadets cruised to a nine-shot victory over Shenendehowa.
"They felt like they let it slip last year," 13th-year Academy coach Jak Bestle said. "Other teams played really well, and they wanted to get back to the top this year. On top of that, they wanted to get as many guys as possible to make it through to the next round. These are four seniors who have been together since freshman year, so it's a pretty special thing moving on to Orchard Creek next week."
The top 27 — anyone who shot 83 or better — advanced to Tuesday's A-B-C-D championship at Orchard Creek. They will compete with the top 20 from Tuesday's Class B and C-D sectionals in a 36-hole competition to determine the nine-player state team. The field will be cut to the top 16 before the final round Thursday, Oct. 15.
The top four Cadets qualified, although Sneeringer lost medalist honors to Bethlehem sophomore Austin Fox , younger brother of two-time sectional champion Victor Fox , who shot 71.
"I've grown about six inches from last year," said Fox, who had four kick-in birdies and three bogeys, "so I'm hitting the ball a lot farther and I've gotten a little better at hitting the ball straighter."
Shen advanced five players to the A-B-C-D qualifier but didn't have a player at par as Academy did with Sneeringer, who shot 84 last year and didn't advance to Orchard Creek. He contributed a 77 to the Cadets' winning effort in his sophomore season.
"At least for me, it helped so much," Sneeringer said of being part of the 2013 sectional champs. "Even last year I was even nervous going into sectionals, and today I don't think I was nervous at all. I didn't make any bad decisions because of it. Even on the last hole, the last couple of putts, I was pretty even keel."
"It was a mission at the beginning of the year to get back to this point," Bestle said. "There was really an air of confidence all week. I hadn't seen that in a while. It was fun to see them come through on the course."
pdougherty@timesunion.com • 518-454-5416 • @Pete_Dougherty
Section II Class A golf
a advanced to next week's A-B-C-D qualifier
